timeline_html:
Here’s what I’m seeing: Your shedding began roughly 4 months before this check‑in (around May 2025). The picture lines up with several overlapping triggers:

  • Chronic illness flare that started in Feb 2025 and is still active — this is the dominant driver and keeps your shedding in “waves.”
  • Medication change from Mar–May 2025, which added an extra push of fallout but has now eased.
  • Major emotional stress, though no date was given; these usually echo in shedding 2–3 months later.

Why these matter: Illness flares, medication shifts, and emotional stress all disturb the follicle growth cycle, pushing more hairs into the resting/shedding phase with a 2–4 month delay. Because your flare hasn’t resolved, the cycle hasn’t yet fully calmed.

Timeline forecast ⏳
• Worst shedding months: May–Jun 2025.
• Medication fallout: should have settled by Sep 2025.
• Stabilization: will only begin 4–8 weeks after the illness flare eases.
• Regrowth 🌱: usually shows 6–8 weeks after stabilization, with little baby hairs coming in at the hairline.

Where you are now: You’re in the stabilization phase — the medication effect is fading, but the ongoing illness flare is stretching out the shedding. The lack of baby hairs is expected for now; once your system steadies, regrowth will follow quickly.

❤️ Remember: your hair is resilient. As your body finds balance, your follicles will shift back into growth mode.
